s.text: After that it gets pretty quiet around here, but check in throughout the long weekend for "Today's Papers" and in case Chatterbox has a postprandial thought or two.

It would be a joy to watch him perform that particular wiggle.
After that it gets pretty quiet around here, but check in throughout the long weekend for "Today's Papers" and in case Chatterbox has a postprandial thought or two.
A nearly full week's worth of Slate will also be posted online Wednesday.
Brill didn't do it the easy way for two good reasons.

Kendall, the president's lawyer, not even intending a perjury trap, asked Starr whether anybody had been fired for leaking, and Starr said, "No, because I don't believe anyone has leaked grand jury information."
Then he issued a mixture of lies and weasels about it, making it virtually impossible for him to give an honest answer if asked a straightforward question.
